| A spell golem:* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* is [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is neither male nor female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* resists death magic.
* does not naturally [regenerate](/wiki/Regenerate "Regenerate") HP. |                                                                          |

A **spell golem**, ', is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). The spell golem is a type of [golem](/wiki/Golem "Golem") that is a stronger variation of the [paper golem](/wiki/Paper_golem "Paper golem") with [spellcasting abilities](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), as well as standard golem traits: it is [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious") and incapable of [regenerating](/wiki/Regenerating "Regenerating") [HP](/wiki/HP "HP").

A spell golem has a claw attack and the ability to cast one [mage spell](/wiki/DNetHack_monster_spells "DNetHack monster spells") during each of its turns, and possesses [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and [death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance") like all golems.

## Generation

Randomly generated spell golems are always hostile. Spell golems always generate with 20 HP.

Spell golems drop up to 8 random non-[blank](/wiki/Scroll_of_blank_paper "Scroll of blank paper") [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") upon death [in place of a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"): each scroll type has an equal probability of being dropped, and never includes [ward](/index.php?title=Scroll_of_ward\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Scroll of ward (page does not exist)"), [warding](/index.php?title=Scroll_of_warding\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Scroll of warding (page does not exist)"), [antimagic](/index.php?title=Scroll_of_antimagic\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Scroll of antimagic (page does not exist)"), [resistance](/index.php?title=Scroll_of_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Scroll of resistance (page does not exist)"), or [consecration](/wiki/Scroll_of_consecration "Scroll of consecration") scrolls or any scrolls that are not randomly generated (e.g. [scrolls of mail](/wiki/Scrolls_of_mail "Scrolls of mail")).

## Encyclopedia entry

The spell golem shares the following [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry with other golem monsters that lack their own entry:

"The original story harks back, so they say, to the sixteenth  
century. Using long-lost formulas from the Kabbala, a rabbi is  
said to have made an artificial man -- the so-called Golem -- to  
help ring the bells in the Synagogue and for all kinds of other  
menial work.  
"But he hadn't made a full man, and it was animated by some sort  
of vegetable half-life. What life it had, too, so the story  
runs, was only derived from the magic charm placed behind its  
teeth each day, that drew down to itself what was known as the  
\`free sidereal strength of the universe.'  
"One evening, before evening prayers, the rabbi forgot to take  
the charm out of the Golem's mouth, and it fell into a frenzy.  
It raged through the dark streets, smashing everything in its  
path, until the rabbi caught up with it, removed the charm, and  
destroyed it. Then the Golem collapsed, lifeless. All that was  
left of it was a small clay image, which you can still see in  
the Old Synagogue." ...

\[ The Golem, by Gustav Meyrink ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Spell_golem\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Spell golem

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
' spell golem
Difficulty 12
Attacks Claw 1d10 physical, Cast 0d0 mage spell
' spell golem
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Claw 1d10 physical, Cast 0d0 mage spell

Base level 10
Base experience 261
Speed 12
Base AC 5
Base MR 90
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 750
Nutritional value 0
Size large
Resistances sleep, poison

A spell golem:

  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • does not naturally regenerate HP.

A spell golem, ', is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. The spell golem is a type of golem that is a stronger variation of the paper golem with spellcasting abilities, as well as standard golem traits: it is thick-skinned, amphibious and incapable of regenerating HP.

A spell golem has a claw attack and the ability to cast one mage spell during each of its turns, and possesses sleep resistance, poison resistance and death resistance like all golems.

Generation

Randomly generated spell golems are always hostile. Spell golems always generate with 20 HP.

Spell golems drop up to 8 random non-blank scrolls upon death in place of a corpse: each scroll type has an equal probability of being dropped, and never includes ward, warding, antimagic, resistance, or consecration scrolls or any scrolls that are not randomly generated (e.g. scrolls of mail).

Encyclopedia entry

The spell golem shares the following encyclopedia entry with other golem monsters that lack their own entry:

"The original story harks back, so they say, to the sixteenth
century. Using long-lost formulas from the Kabbala, a rabbi is
said to have made an artificial man -- the so-called Golem -- to
help ring the bells in the Synagogue and for all kinds of other
menial work.
"But he hadn't made a full man, and it was animated by some sort
of vegetable half-life. What life it had, too, so the story
runs, was only derived from the magic charm placed behind its
teeth each day, that drew down to itself what was known as the
`free sidereal strength of the universe.'
"One evening, before evening prayers, the rabbi forgot to take
the charm out of the Golem's mouth, and it fell into a frenzy.
It raged through the dark streets, smashing everything in its
path, until the rabbi caught up with it, removed the charm, and
destroyed it. Then the Golem collapsed, lifeless. All that was
left of it was a small clay image, which you can still see in
the Old Synagogue." ...

[ The Golem, by Gustav Meyrink ]
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''spell golem''', {{white|'}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. The spell golem is a type of [[golem]] that is a stronger variation of the [[paper golem]] with [[Monster spell|spellcasting abilities]], as well as standard golem traits: it is [[thick-skinned]], [[amphibious]] and incapable of [[regenerating]] [[HP]].

A spell golem has a claw attack and the ability to cast one [[dNetHack monster spells|mage spell]] during each of its turns, and possesses [[sleep resistance]], [[poison resistance]] and [[death resistance]] like all golems.

==Generation==
Randomly generated spell golems are always hostile. Spell golems always generate with 20 HP.

Spell golems drop up to 8 random non-[[Scroll of blank paper|blank]] [[scroll]]s upon death [[Corpseless|in place of a corpse]]: each scroll type has an equal probability of being dropped, and never includes {{? of|ward|warding|antimagic|resistance|or=1|consecration}} scrolls or any scrolls that are not randomly generated (e.g. [[scrolls of mail]]).

==Encyclopedia entry==
The spell golem shares the following [[encyclopedia]] entry with other golem monsters that lack their own entry:
{{encyclopedia|
"The original story harks back, so they say, to the sixteenth
century.  Using long-lost formulas from the Kabbala, a rabbi is
said to have made an artificial man -- the so-called Golem -- to
help ring the bells in the Synagogue and for all kinds of other
menial work.
"But he hadn't made a full man, and it was animated by some sort
of vegetable half-life.  What life it had, too, so the story
runs, was only derived from the magic charm placed behind its
teeth each day, that drew down to itself what was known as the
`free sidereal strength of the universe.'
"One evening, before evening prayers, the rabbi forgot to take
the charm out of the Golem's mouth, and it fell into a frenzy.
It raged through the dark streets, smashing everything in its
path, until the rabbi caught up with it, removed the charm, and
destroyed it.  Then the Golem collapsed, lifeless.  All that was
left of it was a small clay image, which you can still see in
the Old Synagogue." ...
|[ The Golem, by Gustav Meyrink ]
